name: Worker Skills & Training Management
description: Skills tracking, training management, and certification system for workers

prd.problem: Superintendents need to assign workers to tasks based on their skills and certifications, but tracking who is trained on what equipment, who has current certifications, and proficiency levels is manual and error-prone, leading to safety issues and inefficient assignments.
prd.solution: Build a comprehensive skills tracking system where each worker has a skills profile showing certifications (pesticide applicator, equipment operation, etc.), training completion dates, expiration dates, and proficiency levels. System should alert when certifications are expiring and support training record uploads.
successCriteria: Skills taxonomy defined for golf course maintenance
Workers can be assigned multiple skills with proficiency levels
Certification tracking with expiration dates and alerts
Reporting on skill gaps and training needs
Integration with task assignment to match skills to requirements
assumptions: Standard skills taxonomy can be defined
risks: Certification expiration tracking must be reliable for compliance
Skill proficiency assessment may be subjective
Maintaining up-to-date skill requirements per task
